content.text: The diagram shows an isosceles triangle with the base extended.
Find the value of \(x\).
(b) The diagram shows three lines meeting at a point.
The ratio \(a:b:c=3:4:5\).
Find the value of \(c\).
(c) A regular pentagon has an exterior angle, \(d\). A regular hexagon has an interior angle, \(h\).
Find the fraction \(\frac{d}{h}\).
Give your answer in its simplest form.
2 (a) Anil changes \(\$ 830\) into euros when the exchange rate is \(1 \mathrm{euro}=\$ 1.16\).
He spends 500 euros.
He then changes the remaining money back into dollars at the same exchange rate.
Work out how much, in dollars, Anil receives.
(i) He spends \(\$ 12400\) on bills in 2021.
Calculate the percentage of his earnings he spends on bills.
(ii) His earnings of \(\$ 37000\) increase by \(3.2 \%\) in 2022.
Calculate his earnings in 2022.
(i) Calculate the total interest earned at the end of 5 years.
(ii) Find the number of complete years before Anil has at least \(\$ 5000\) in this account.
(c) Anil invests \(\$ 3500\) in an account that pays a rate of \(2.4 \%\) per year compound interest.
(a) (i) The area of the triangle is \(60 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
(ii) Solve by factorisation.
(iii) Calculate angle \(A C B\).
(i) Find the size of the smallest angle of triangle \(D E F\).
(ii) Find the length of the shortest side of triangle \(D E F\).
(b) Triangle \(A B C\) is similar to triangle \(D E F\). Triangle \(D E F\) has an area of \(93.75 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
The diagram shows a right-angled triangle \(A B C\).
(a) (i) Write down the interval containing the median.
(ii) Calculate an estimate of the mean height.
(b) (i) One of these children is chosen at random.
Calculate the probability that they have a height of 1.4 m or less.
(ii) Two of these children are chosen at random.
Calculate the probability that both children are taller than 1.5 m but only one of them is taller than 1.8 m .
(c) (i) Complete the cumulative frequency table for the heights.
(ii) On the grid, draw the cumulative frequency diagram.
(i) the interquartile range
(ii) the 60th percentile.
(d) Use your diagram to find an estimate of
4 The table shows information about the heights of 80 children.
(i) Calculate the volume of the cone.
[The volume, \(V\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and height \(h\) is \(V=\frac{1}{3} \pi r^{2} h\).]
(ii) A label completely covers the curved surface area of the cone.
Calculate the area of the label as a percentage of the total surface area of the cone.
[The curved surface area, \(A\), of a cone with radius \(r\) and slant height \(l\) is \(A=\pi r l\).]
A cone has base diameter 8 cm and perpendicular height 15 cm .
(i) Find the time taken, in minutes and seconds, for all the water to be poured into the container.
(ii) Calculate the height of the water in the container.
An empty cylindrical container has radius 0.45 m . 300 litres of water is poured into the container at a rate of 375 ml per second.
(i) Find the first three terms of this sequence.
Give your answers as fractions.
(ii) The \(k\)th term of this sequence is \(\frac{12}{25}\).
Find the value of \(k\).
6 (a) A sequence has \(n\)th term \(\frac{n}{2 n+3}\).
(b) Find the \(n\)th term of each sequence.
(a) Show that angle \(A C B=95.1^{\circ}\), correct to 1 decimal place.
(b) Without stopping, a car travels from town \(A\) to town \(C\) then to town \(B\), before returning directly to town \(A\).
The total time taken for the journey is 3 hours 20 minutes.
Calculate the average speed of the car for this journey.
Give your answer in kilometres per hour.
The diagram shows the straight roads between town \(A\), town \(B\) and town \(C\).
\(A C=60 \mathrm{~km}, C B=87 \mathrm{~km}\) and \(B\) is due east of \(A\).
The bearing of \(C\) from \(A\) is \(038^{\circ}\).
8 (a) (i) Show that the equation \(y=(x-4)(x+1)(x-2)\) can be written as \(y=x^{3}-5 x^{2}+2 x+8\).
(ii) On the diagram, sketch the graph of \(y=x^{3}-5 x^{2}+2 x+8\), indicating the values where the graph crosses the axes.
(b) The graph of \(y=x^{3}-5 x^{2}+2 x+8\) has two tangents with a gradient of 10 .
Find the equations of these two tangents.
You must show all your working and give your answers in the form \(y=m x+c\).
9 (a) Simplify.
(b) (i) Factorise.
(ii) Simplify.
(c) Solve the simultaneous equations.
You must show all your working and give your answers correct to 2 decimal places.
\(A B C D E F G H\) is a cuboid with a square base of side \(x \mathrm{~cm}\).
\(C G=20 \mathrm{~cm}\) and \(A G=28 \mathrm{~cm}\).
Calculate the value of \(x\).
The diagram shows a different cuboid \(J K L M N P Q R\).
\(M R=30 \mathrm{~cm}\) correct to the nearest centimetre.
\(K R=37 \mathrm{~cm}\) correct to the nearest centimetre.
Calculate the lower bound of the angle between \(K R\) and the base \(J K L M\) of the cuboid.
